question: CAN YOU PLEASE HELP ME, WHAT AM I DOING WRONG?
question_content:
This summer has been one of the most depressing summers of my life. After returning home from my freshmen year of college, I've realized that no one seems to truly care about me. My parents still scream at me, verbally degrade me, and use violence on me. The girls who I thought were my friends, whom I went out of my way to help throughout the year, just used me to get better housing (and of course my roommate's now not coming back so I'm left struggling to find someone to live with). I worked extremely hard throughout high school and am in a BS/MD program (guaranteed spot at a very highly ranked medical school), yet I can't help feel like there's something awful about me. What do I do?

I am incredibly involved on campus. I'm the treasurer of two different clubs, the social chair of another, and an orientation leader for first year students. I'm also in the honors program. This doesn't change anything.

No, there is zero alcoholism in my family's history. No narcotics either.

Forget about those girls who used you. Do you have any friends from highschool you can hangout with or a job? Keeping busy will help you not feel as depressed. As for your parents, I'm not really sure if you can change that by yourself if they are using violence. Have you talked to them about how you feel? If that doesn't work, you should tell someone you trust. Family counciling might be a good idea.
Good Luck!
